threads.com:
/vmg/ is a place to discuss all types of mobile games, including both Android and iOS, phones and tablets. Please note that Nintendo and Sony handhelds are considered consoles, and that threads pertaining to those platforms and their gaming titles should be posted elsewhere.

Does this mean discussion of mobile games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vmg/ is just a separate board specifically focused on mobile games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vmg/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1062277
>>1062282
I don't think it's that bad if it's handled correctly.

The current situation is bad for one major reason: new SS are bad. This is a really shitty place to be in, as we very quickly moved into the territory where you NEED lvl 110, or else you can basically forget doing stuff. LB doesn't even matter. lvl 100 lb1 < lvl 110 lb0.
This situation needed change. There's also another reason this needed to change: What are new people going to do? If you play for a while you get your S upgrades eventually, but new people are.. new.

This change will do 2 very important things:
-SS without an S do no longer have massive disadvantages (think Miko, Mari or even some that only have a relatively recent S like Higuchi)
-SS lb1 is no longer weaker than ss lb0 but max lb S.
-SS lb2 also has more value as it bumps the level cap higher than what you can do with S

I'm not sure if they massively bump the stat requirement. Yes, everything gets stronger to an extend, but I feel like a lot of it had to get stronger to deal with the 340 we have now. Easy example Yunyun. She dies turn 2 against hailhorses if they focus her, and there's literally nothing you can do about this. 10 levels will help.

This was a necessary change going forward. It's a really shitty situation to get a new SS and it's unusable because the level cap is garbage and you are only happy about those that have an event S. Now every SS basically has a former event S, and those with an event S still have a bit of an edge, just not as big anymore. If they don't screw up max LB S style supports, this is only positive and much needed going forward.

tl;dr: This should be a LOT better balanced than what we have right now.
